channel.title: New item models?
channel.description:
How do i get models and add them to the client?
thanks
-lewis.

yea i know how to do that thanks alot for the help.

item.title: New item models?
item.dc:creator: @Gold_Light Gold Light
item.description:
@Gold_Light wrote:

well after you add models #### close client compile and re-load it that’s about it nothing on server side. Unless you don’t know how to add the item to Item.CFG and give it stats?

Read full topic

item.title: New item models?
item.dc:creator: @lewis2 lewis`
item.description:
@lewis2 wrote:

[quote=“Gold Light, post:4, topic:274131”]you would add the ints according to this

     if(i == 8002) // Item ID 
     {
        class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
        class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; 
        class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws";
        class8.aByteArray178 = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes();
        class8.anInt174 = 13699; // model
        class8.anInt181 = 630;
        class8.anInt190 = 268;
        class8.anInt198 = 1340;
        class8.anInt204 = 0;
        class8.anInt169 = -7;
        class8.anInt194 = -13;
        class8.anInt165 = 13698; // model
        class8.anInt200 = 13698; // model
        class8.anInt188 = -1;
        class8.anInt164 = -1;
        class8.anInt175 = -1;
        class8.anInt197 = -1;
    }

these are Ints, You need to add Ints for every item or npc you add
just go into class8 and search for any other item you have and add that one under the bracket.

save compile then run go onto your server and type add models ####
the #### is the models number that you added into the model folder for dragon claws. you understand?[/quote]

ok thanks alot.

do i have to change anything to the server itself? just the client? (i know you have to add special but anything else)

Read full topic

item.title: New item models?
item.dc:creator: @Gold_Light Gold Light
item.description:
@Gold_Light wrote:

you would add the ints according to this

     if(i == 8002) // Item ID 
     {
        class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
        class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; 
        class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws";
        class8.aByteArray178 = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes();
        class8.anInt174 = 13699; // model
        class8.anInt181 = 630;
        class8.anInt190 = 268;
        class8.anInt198 = 1340;
        class8.anInt204 = 0;
        class8.anInt169 = -7;
        class8.anInt194 = -13;
        class8.anInt165 = 13698; // model
        class8.anInt200 = 13698; // model
        class8.anInt188 = -1;
        class8.anInt164 = -1;
        class8.anInt175 = -1;
        class8.anInt197 = -1;
    }

these are Ints, You need to add Ints for every item or npc you add
just go into class8 and search for any other item you have and add that one under the bracket.

save compile then run go onto your server and type add models ####
the #### is the models number that you added into the model folder for dragon claws. you understand?

item.title: New item models?
item.dc:creator: @lewis2 lewis`
item.description:
@lewis2 wrote:

[quote=“Gold Light, post:2, topic:274131”]Get models? you can download clients and take models lol or just look around there is a model viewer some where.

You get the models and put them into models folder, then of course you need to add the Ints depending if its items or npc’s, Item ints go into class8.java npc ints go into class5.java if you need more information just say so.[/quote]

so if i added the dragon claw model into the model folder in the client folder and then what whould i have to add into the class8?

Read full topic

item.title: New item models?
item.dc:creator: @Gold_Light Gold Light
item.description:
@Gold_Light wrote:

Get models? you can download clients and take models lol or just look around there is a model viewer some where.

You get the models and put them into models folder, then of course you need to add the Ints depending if its items or npc’s, Item ints go into class8.java npc ints go into class5.java if you need more information just say so.

Read full topic
